intro: Hieracium chlorobracteum, commonly known as the green bract hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat hairy. Its flowers are typically yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Hieracium chlorobracteum is often found in grasslands and open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
